title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.4 ACCÈS EAU POTABLE, ASSAINISSE

description.narrative: By 2017, the Water, Sanitation and Hygiene sector has reinforced capacities to increase the rates of access to potable water, sanitation and hygiene of rural and peri-urban populations, which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: In 2017, an integrated package of high impact interventions in child survival and development is scaled up to national level, particularly for the most disadvantaged populations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, the Water, Sanitation and Hygiene sector has reinforced capacities to increase the rates of access to potable water,sanitation and hygiene of rural and peri-urban populations

description.narrative: Government counterparts have strengthened capacities on the design of rural water supply scheme including solar powered water pumping system to ensure quality, sustainability and affordability of services provided to the most vulnerable. Programmatic instruments were developed to strengthen the framework for water supply and sanitation in rural areas. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/01/2018
